expert_testimony: expert testimony confirms they cover such formulations but lack specific claims required by law
decision_reasoning: patents in question relate to controlled-release systems and tablets but do not explicitly claim paroxetine hydrochloride or its use
conclusion_outcome: 393 and 479 patents do not meet the requirements of s. 4(2)(b) and are ineligible for inclusion on the Patent Register
cause_of_action: GSK sought judicial review after Health Canada rejected their patents for non-compliance with PMNOC Regulations
procedure_followed: Court analyzed patent claims, expert evidence, and relevant case law to determine compliance with statutory requirements
result_of_case: Application dismissed; patents remain ineligible for registration
